standard.name: ISO/IEC 27001
standard.description: This standard specifies the requirements for establishing, implementing, maintaining and continually improving an information security management system (ISMS) within the context of the organization. It is applicable to AI software development in ensuring the security of both data and systems throughout the development lifecycle.

requirements.name: Information Security Policies
requirements.description: Establish policies to ensure the security of information relevant to AI development, to manage data integrity and confidentiality.

requirements.name: Risk Assessment and Treatment
requirements.description: Perform regular risk assessments and implement risk treatment plans specifically for AI applications, focusing on potential data breaches and system vulnerabilities.

standard.name: IEEE 7000-2021
standard.description: Model Process for Addressing Ethical Concerns During System Design. It specifically addresses ethical concerns in AI systems, providing guidelines for responsible AI development.

requirements.name: Ethical Risk Assessments
requirements.description: Conduct ethical risk assessments to identify and mitigate potential ethical issues in AI system functionalities.

requirements.name: Stakeholder Inclusion
requirements.description: Include diverse stakeholder input in AI software design processes to ensure broader ethical considerations are covered.

controls.name: Secure Development Practices
controls.description: Implement secure development practices such as code reviews and security testing prior to release. This control ensures that vulnerabilities are identified and addressed before the software is deployed. Monitoring is continuous with monthly assessments.

controls.name: AI Ethics Guidelines
controls.description: Establish and follow AI ethics guidelines in the development process, focusing on fairness, transparency, and accountability. This control ensures that AI systems are designed and implemented ethically. Compliance checks are done on a quarterly basis.

risks.name: Data Breach
risks.description: A data breach could result in unauthorized access to sensitive data used or generated by AI systems. Failure to implement secure development practices could lead to significant financial and reputational damage.

risks.name: Algorithmic Bias
risks.description: Algorithmic bias can occur if AI systems make decisions that are biased or unfair. Without proper ethics guidelines, this risks legal action and loss of user trust.

standard.name: ISO 9001:2015
standard.description: The ISO 9001:2015 standard is focused on meeting customer expectations and delivering customer satisfaction. It provides a framework for quality management systems (QMS) and ensures organizations can consistently provide products and services that fulfill the customer's demands.

requirements.name: Customer Focus
requirements.description: Organizations must understand current and future customer needs, meet customer requirements, and strive to exceed customer expectations. This principle is crucial for consumer behavior analysis to tailor strategies that align with customer preferences.

requirements.name: Evidence-based Decision Making
requirements.description: Decisions should be based on the analysis and evaluation of data. This requirement ensures that consumer behavior analysis is conducted scientifically and the results are reliable and valid.

standard.name: GDPR Compliance
standard.description: The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) imposes strict data protection requirements on organizations handling EU citizens' personal data. It ensures that consumer behavior analysis respects privacy rights and complies with legal obligations.

requirements.name: Data Protection by Design
requirements.description: Organizations must integrate data protection into processing activities and business practices. In consumer behavior analysis, data protection principles should be embedded in data collection and analysis processes.

requirements.name: Consent Management
requirements.description: Businesses must obtain explicit consent from individuals before collecting, processing, or sharing their data. This ensures transparency and trust in consumer behavior analysis projects.

controls.name: Data Validation Procedures
controls.description: Implement strict data validation and cleansing procedures to ensure accurate analysis of consumer behavior data. Monitoring should occur at each stage of data processing to mitigate errors and inaccuracies.

controls.name: Privacy Impact Assessments
controls.description: Conduct regular privacy impact assessments to evaluate risks and determine strategies for mitigating data privacy issues. These assessments should be conducted at least annually or when a significant change in data processing occurs.

controls.name: Customer Feedback Mechanism
controls.description: Establish a robust system for collecting, analyzing, and acting on customer feedback. Regular reviews and updates (quarterly) ensure that consumer preferences and expectations are being continuously met.

risks.name: Data Inaccuracies
risks.description: Inaccurate consumer data can result in misguided strategies and financial losses. Data validation procedures reduce these risks by ensuring only accurate and reliable data is used.

risks.name: Privacy Breaches
risks.description: Failure to comply with GDPR can lead to severe reputational damage and financial penalties. Regular privacy impact assessments can identify vulnerabilities and prevent privacy breaches.

risks.name: Misalignment with Customer Needs
risks.description: Ignoring customer feedback can lead to the development of products or services that do not align with consumer needs, reducing market competitiveness. A robust feedback mechanism ensures continuous alignment with consumer expectations.

standard.name: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
standard.description: The GDPR is a robust data protection framework that ensures the privacy and security of personal data collected, processed, and stored by organizations. It applies to all companies processing the personal data of data subjects residing in the European Union, regardless of the company's location.

requirements.name: Consent Management
requirements.description: Ensure that explicit consent is obtained from users prior to collecting their personal data for recommendation services. This includes providing clear and concise information about data usage and giving users the option to withdraw consent at any time.

requirements.name: Data Minimization
requirements.description: Limit the collection and processing of personal data to data that is adequate, relevant, and necessary for the recommendation service. Regularly audit data collected to ensure compliance with the data minimization principle.

standard.name: ISO/IEC 27001
standard.description: ISO/IEC 27001 is an international standard for managing information security. It provides a systematic approach to managing sensitive company information, ensuring it remains secure by applying a risk management process.

requirements.name: Risk Assessment and Treatment
requirements.description: Implement a process for regularly assessing information security risks and treating them based on the risk acceptance criteria of the organization.

requirements.name: Access Control Policy
requirements.description: Establish policies that restrict access to information based on business requirements and implement procedures to prevent unauthorized access to information systems that handle recommendations.

controls.name: User Consent Verification
controls.description: Regularly verify that consent has been obtained from users for processing their data as per GDPR requirements. This should be done during initial data collection and whenever there are changes in how personal data is utilized.

controls.name: Data Access Monitoring
controls.description: Monitor and audit user access logs to ensure that only authorized personnel access personal data critical to the recommendation service as per the established access control policy under ISO/IEC 27001.

controls.name: Regular Risk Assessments
controls.description: Conduct regular risk assessments to identify potential vulnerabilities in the data collection and processing systems for the recommendation services and apply appropriate mitigation measures.

risks.name: Unauthorized Data Access
risks.description: If unauthorized access to user data occurs, it could lead to data breaches, loss of user trust, and significant legal penalties, especially under GDPR compliance violations.

risks.name: Non-compliance with Data Consent
risks.description: Failing to secure user consent could lead to non-compliance with GDPR, resulting in legal consequences, fines, and reputation damage.

risks.name: Inadequate Risk Management
risks.description: Without regular assessments, emerging threats may remain unidentified, leaving the systems vulnerable to attacks or data leaks, which can be costly and damage the organization's reputation.

standard.name: ISO 27001
standard.description: ISO 27001 is the international standard for information security management systems (ISMS). It helps organizations to systematically manage sensitive information while ensuring its confidentiality, integrity, and availability. This standard is applicable to any organization that manages sensitive information and applies a risk management process to secure data.

requirements.name: Access Control
requirements.description: Define and manage roles and access levels to ensure only authorized personnel can execute automated adjustments and access related data.

requirements.name: Data Integrity
requirements.description: Implement measures to protect the accuracy and trustworthiness of data within automated adjustments, ensuring it is not altered by unauthorized parties.

standard.name: COBIT 2019
standard.description: COBIT 2019 is a framework for developing, implementing, monitoring, and improving IT governance and management practices. It is designed to guide enterprises towards achieving strategic goals through effective and innovative use of IT.

requirements.name: Change Management
requirements.description: Establish a formal change management process for automated adjustments to up-hold a controlled and consistent environment.

requirements.name: Performance Monitoring
requirements.description: Deploy mechanisms to continuously monitor the performance of automated adjustments and ensure they remain aligned with organizational objectives.

controls.name: Role-Based Access Control
controls.description: Implement role-based access control mechanisms to ensure only authorized personnel can execute and manage automated adjustments. Monitor access logs weekly to detect unauthorized access attempts.

controls.name: Data Validation Procedures
controls.description: Conduct data integrity checks and validation procedures daily to safeguard the accuracy of data used in automated adjustments, reducing errors and unauthorized modifications.

controls.name: Change Management Logs
controls.description: Maintain detailed logs of all changes made to automated adjustment processes, with quarterly audits to ensure compliance with established change management policies.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access
risks.description: The risk of unauthorized access to automated adjustments could result in fraudulent activities or data breaches. This relates to the control of Role-Based Access Control by ensuring only authorized users can make changes.

risks.name: Data Inaccuracy
risks.description: Inaccurate data in automated adjustments might lead to faulty outcomes affecting business processes. This risk is mitigated by the Data Validation Procedures control, which ensures data accuracy and integrity.

risks.name: Uncontrolled Changes
risks.description: Without thorough change management, unauthorized or improper modifications to the adjustment process could disrupt operations. The Change Management Logs control helps mitigate this risk by ensuring all changes are logged and reviewed.

standard.name: ISO/IEC 27001:2022
standard.description: The ISO/IEC 27001:2022 standard is focused on information security management systems, providing requirements for establishing, implementing, maintaining, and continually improving an information security management system (ISMS). It is applicable to any organization, regardless of its type or size, seeking to manage the security of assets such as financial information, intellectual property, employee details, or information entrusted by third parties.

requirements.name: Asset Management
requirements.description: Establish and maintain an accurate inventory of information assets to ensure protection responsibilities are understood. This requirement is crucial for the organization to identify and classify information assets, ensuring their protection according to their value and risk.

requirements.name: Access Control Policy
requirements.description: Implement an access control policy that manages who can access information and systems based on business and security conditions. This requirement ensures that access permissions are aligned with business roles and security needs.

standard.name: ITIL 4
standard.description: ITIL 4 is a framework for IT service management that provides comprehensive processes and best practices for managing IT services and aligning them with business needs. Its purpose is to improve efficiency and achieve predictable service delivery.

requirements.name: Service Level Management
requirements.description: Define, document, agree, monitor, measure, and report on service levels to ensure that all service delivery and support meet agreed-upon targets. Crucial for aligning IT services with business expectations.

requirements.name: Change Control
requirements.description: Implement standardized methods and procedures for efficient handling of all changes, to minimize the impact of change-related incidents on service quality and consequently improve the daily operations.

controls.name: Regular Security Assessments
controls.description: Conduct regular security assessments to identify vulnerabilities in the platform. These assessments are crucial for discovering and mitigating potential security threats, ensuring platform integrity. They should be conducted quarterly.

controls.name: Access Audits
controls.description: Perform regular audits of access permissions to ensure compliance with the access control policy. These audits check that users have appropriate access rights, minimizing unauthorized access risks. Audits should be conducted bi-annually.

controls.name: Change Management Process
controls.description: Implement a change management process to track and manage changes in the platform. This control helps in minimizing disruptions and reverting changes if necessary. Changes should be reviewed monthly.

risks.name: Unauthorized Access
risks.description: Potential breach of sensitive data due to inappropriate access permissions. If not managed through proper access audits, this risk could lead to data theft, loss of customer trust, and legal penalties.

risks.name: Data Breach
risks.description: Security vulnerabilities leading to unauthorized data access. Conducting regular security assessments aims to identify and mitigate these vulnerabilities, avoiding data breaches that could result in severe financial and reputational damage.

risks.name: Service Downtime
risks.description: Ineffective change management could lead to unexpected service interruptions. Without a robust change management process, service downtime might incur significant operational and financial losses.

standard.name: ISO 9001:2015 - Quality Management Systems
standard.description: ISO 9001:2015 specifies requirements for a quality management system when an organization needs to demonstrate its ability to consistently provide products and services that meet customer and regulatory requirements and aims to enhance customer satisfaction through the effective application of the system.

requirements.name: Customer Focus
requirements.description: The organization should understand the current and future needs of customers, meet customer requirements, and strive to exceed customer expectations.

requirements.name: Leadership
requirements.description: Leaders should establish a unity of purpose and direction for the organization. They should create an environment in which people are engaged in achieving the organization’s quality objectives.

standard.name: ISO 31000:2018 - Risk Management
standard.description: ISO 31000:2018 provides guidelines on managing risk faced by organizations. The application of these guidelines can be customized to any organization and its context, aimed at creating and protecting value by managing risks, making decisions, setting and achieving objectives, and improving performance.

requirements.name: Risk Assessment
requirements.description: Identify risks that could potentially affect the achievement of objectives, analyse and evaluate risks, and manage them appropriately.

requirements.name: Risk Treatment
requirements.description: Select and implement measures to modify risk. Controls or treatments may include avoiding, accepting, removing, or modifying risk sources.

controls.name: Customer Satisfaction Surveys
controls.description: Conduct regular surveys to gather feedback from clients regarding their experience with services. This helps in identifying areas of improvement and ensuring client satisfaction. Frequency: Quarterly.

controls.name: Risk Identification Workshops
controls.description: Organize workshops with key stakeholders to identify potential risks related to client acquisition and management. Frequency: Bi-annual.

controls.name: Client Relationship Management System
controls.description: Implement a CRM system to manage interactions with current and potential clients. It helps in understanding customer needs and improving service delivery. Frequency: Continuous monitoring and updates.

risks.name: Client Dissatisfaction
risks.description: Client dissatisfaction can lead to loss of business and reputation. By not addressing this, the organization risks decreased client loyalty and negative word-of-mouth. Control: Customer Satisfaction Surveys (CTRL-0001).

risks.name: Failure to Identify Key Risks
risks.description: Not identifying key risks can lead to unexpected problems, financial losses, and project delays. This risk is linked to unaddressed or poorly managed risks. Control: Risk Identification Workshops (CTRL-0002).

risks.name: Ineffective Client Management
risks.description: Without an effective client management system, the organization may miss opportunities for growth and improved customer relationships, leading to potential loss in market competitiveness. Control: Client Relationship Management System (CTRL-0003).

standard.name: ISO 9001
standard.description: ISO 9001 is an international standard that outlines the criteria for a quality management system (QMS). It is used by organizations to demonstrate the ability to consistently provide products and services that meet customer expectations and regulatory requirements. This standard is applicable to any organization, regardless of its size or industry, that aims to improve customer satisfaction through effective quality management.

requirements.name: Customer Focus
requirements.description: Understand and meet customer needs and requirements to enhance satisfaction. This involves listening to the voice of the customer and ensuring that their inputs are integrated into the market strategy.

requirements.name: Continuous Improvement
requirements.description: Implement processes for ongoing improvement in strategy development and execution, including feedback mechanisms and performance metrics to ensure adaptability to market changes.

standard.name: ISO 31000
standard.description: ISO 31000 is an international standard for risk management that provides guidelines, principles, and a framework for managing risk. It can be applied to any public or private organization, community group, or individual. The standard aims to help organizations increase the likelihood of achieving objectives, improve the identification of opportunities and threats, and effectively allocate and use resources for risk treatment.

requirements.name: Risk Identification
requirements.description: Establish a systematic approach to identify risks that could impact the market strategy, ensuring that all potential risks are considered in decision-making processes.

requirements.name: Risk Analysis
requirements.description: Conduct detailed risk analysis to understand the nature, sources, and causes of risks affecting the market strategy, leading to better risk management decisions.

standard.name: Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX)
standard.description: The Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX) is a U.S. law that protects investors from fraudulent financial reporting by corporations. It mandates strict reforms to improve financial disclosures from corporations and prevent accounting fraud. While primarily applicable to publicly traded companies, its principles guide corporate governance and risk management in various industries.

requirements.name: Internal Controls Assessment
requirements.description: Assess and document the effectiveness of internal controls over financial reporting related to market strategy impacts, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.

requirements.name: Fraud Risk Management
requirements.description: Implement measures to detect and prevent fraudulent activities that could undermine the market strategy, ensuring the integrity and reliability of financial information.

controls.name: Monthly Market Trend Analysis
controls.description: Conduct a detailed analysis of market trends, customer behavior, and competitive landscape on a monthly basis to adapt strategies in real-time, ensuring alignment with market demands. This control helps in proactively identifying potential threats and opportunities.

controls.name: Quarterly Risk Assessments
controls.description: Perform comprehensive risk assessments on a quarterly basis to identify, analyze, and prioritize risks associated with the market strategy. This helps in formulating responsive strategies and allocating resources effectively.

controls.name: Annual Internal Audit of Strategy Processes
controls.description: Conduct an internal audit of all strategic processes annually to ensure compliance with established controls and standards, and to evaluate the effectiveness of the strategy enhancement initiatives.

risks.name: Market Misalignment
risks.description: Failure to align the market strategy with current market trends can result in lost opportunities and diminished competitive advantage, negatively impacting revenue. Monthly market trend analysis helps mitigate this risk by keeping the strategy relevant and informed.

risks.name: Unidentified Risks
risks.description: Failure to identify risks can lead to unexpected challenges that hinder strategy execution. Quarterly risk assessments ensure that potential risks are identified and managed proactively, reducing the likelihood of significant negative impacts.

risks.name: Non-Compliance with Regulations
risks.description: Non-compliance with financial and strategic regulations can lead to legal penalties, financial losses, and reputational damage. Annual internal audits ensure adherence to regulatory standards and identify areas of non-compliance for corrective actions.
